reviews.review: 距离第一次玩已经有10年的时间了，我现在也只22岁，当初带给我的震撼是无以伦比的，甚至在HL过完任务之前我就先尝试通关OP，相对于HL，OP没有了那么繁琐需要来回跑地图来开开关等。。。等像电影一般的开场，再到引入游戏世界 从黑山醒来，主角一步步变的强大。。。谢华德，我在等你被唤醒

This is a pretty awesome exspansion pack it pretty much offers more of what made Half life so great but with new weapons and new aliens a true product of its time when Epansion packs were awesome and not just cheap 2-3 hour dlc addons no this is a quality 6-8 hour expansion with multiplayer

Pros
Cool new aliens 
Spectacular new weapons 
Your ai buddies actually have decent fire power
The boss battles while nothing to special are way better than the ones from the main game
Shepards mighty rench smites all who oppose you
The multiplayer can be fun 
Alien weaponry is awesome but gross to think about

Cons
I think this game got a bit carried away with the difficulty some of the later levels are just a pain 
Your ai buddies may have better guns but there still pretty stupid
It may be tough for newcomers to get the hang of the multiplayer because I'm pretty sure most people still playing it have been playing since 1999
This game does offer lots of new guns but not many oppertunities to use all of them for instance the Displacer gun is like a BFG with teleprting as a bonus but I only used it like 2-3 times
Not a fan of the HD weapons pack it looks odd and theres no option for the classic weapons

So opposing force is pretty awesome but it does have a few flaws however if you liked Half life you'll like this as it's more of the same but with new stuff added on so yeah I'd recomend this game any day the best way to get it would be through the Half life complete bundle

Consigliato: una buona espansione da circa 5 ore, anche se la trama non è particolarmente degna di nota.

La prima cosa che salta all'occhio sono le armi differenti: se in principio può sembrare che siano semplici reskin, dopo un po' arriverete ad usare armi decisamente inaspettate. Inoltre, la torcia è sostituita dalla visione notturna.

Il gameplay è più o meno invariato, anche se sono presenti più sparatorie che "enigmi" rispetto ad Half Life. Durante la storia ogni tanto ci faranno compagnia altri soldati, che qualche volta sono necessari per andare avanti.

Il neo princiapale è la storia che penso sia un po' "banale". Aggiunge fatti ed eventi alla storia di Half Life, ma secondo me poteva essere fatta diversamente, ed approfondire molte più cose
Basically extra time to play Half-Life. It feels the same, but has a whole lot of additional content, which is great. I highly reccomend this one.

Half Life 1 için çıkan ilk eklenti paketi. Oyunda, deney sonrası meydana gelen olayları örtbas ederek tanıkların hepsini temizlemekle görevli özel kuvvetlerin bir üyesi olan Adrian Shepard'ı kontrol ediyoruz.Gordon Freeman bu kez düşman.Keyifli bir ek paketti.Tavsiye ederim.

This expansion is incredible, not only because it's Half-Life With More Stuff, but how it made me feel being on the Opposing Force.

One of the soldiers stated a line of dialogue that hit me hard: "Government cover-ups were not in my job description!"

Thinking about playing through the original Half-Life, I felt like such an arse for mowing through hordes of soldiers. They're not heartless murder machines, they're humans forced into a fucked-up mission. Gearbox really put character into these guys, enough for me to empathize with them.

I don't like games that involve killing Homo sapiens anyways, and this certainly didn't help. Excellent work.

[b]Opposing Force[/b], the 1st of the three Gearbox expansions for Half-Life, re-tells the story of the Black Mesa Incident from HECU marine Adrian Shephard's perspective. Adding a plethora of new content like Race X (not to be confused with Xen creatures,) and additional weapons; Opposing Force offers an enjoyable yet distinct experience, albeit with somewhat muddled level design. Consider buying it if you enjoy the original Half-Life.

A great continuation of the half life saga, continuing and expanding on the story of the original half life. Keeps all of the core mechanics and enemies to stay familiar, while adding in enough new content to stay fresh and feel different from the others. 
If you enjoyed the original half life (or blue shift) at all, then Opposing Force is a must play.

Muy buen complemento de la historia principal con una jugabilidad mejorada, con nuevas armas y nuevos enemigos. Muy recomendado aunque habia partes donde la cantidad de enemigos era un poco exagerada. 9/10

As time has gone on since I played the first two Half-Life games, I've felt my finger twitch with Half-Life withdrawal. I've wanted to go back to the lack of cutscenes, smooth gameplay, and nailbiting enemies. So, I decided to go back to one of the original expansions for the game made by a young Gearbox Interactive.

Oddly enough, it doesn't have the stench of Borderlands covering it, despite the insane new guns added.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is a new story taking place during the Black Mesa incident, only now told through the perspective of the marines sent in to capture him, namely one marine named Adrian Shepard, who also has the similar affliction of mute-protagonist that Gordon Freeman has. You go through some of the same events around the crumbling science lab, while fighting a new range of alien enemies with a few new weapons. 

The game functions just like the original Half-Life. Slippery running, terrible ladders, and tight gunplay all bundled into one old-school PC video game wet dream. The new weapons are pretty effective. My favorite was the equivalent of the BFG from DOOM. No matter what size the enemy you're fighting is, one hit from the gun will immediately destroy them, which will come in handy with all the new alien species that have been thrown in to f*** up your perfectly fine day.

All that aside, one problem that comes from Opposing Force is that the story isn't anything new. Sure, there's some new developments that bring further light to the conflict between the marines and their federal higher-ups, but it's just more Half-Life. And, yeah, more Half-Life is fine, but I'd just prefer the story do something a little more new than just follow the same events of Freeman, only through new eyes. It's just a 5 hour long version of Half-Life that wouldn't make sense to anyone that hadn't played the original game first.

Opposing Force is still a fun 5-hour long campaign that I felt was worth the money I put into it. If you enjoyed the first Half-Life, you'll still love this expansion. It's just nothing really new or inventive, but as an expasion to an original game... does it really have to be? I'm giving Half-Life: Opposing Force an 8/10. It's a great little experience, but isn't quite as great as it's foundation on which it was constructed.

I first played this when it came out in the Half-Life Platinum Bundle in stores, and at the time it was most likely the best game out there. Even now, it stands out as having some of the most memorable AI, interesting mechanics, and diverse weapons of any game I have ever seen. If you enjoyed Half-Life or any of it's other Gold-Source offshoots, you will like Opposing Force. Opposing force puts the player character into the Black Mesa incident much later than all other games in the series, and keeps the player there far after every other character's story has ended. 

One thing that sets this game far from other titles in the series is its difficulty. There are times when playing on hard that the AI for alien creatures and Black Ops teams seems to be almost mockingly hard. Even though they rely heavily on scripted paths and arenas, the Black Ops teams surpass what any enemy in the rest of the series can do, providing long fights that force the player to both act quickly and prepare for the multitude of tricks the enemy can pull at will.

The weapons in this game were also an enjoyable departure from Half-Life, and may even outshine the innovative gravity gun from the sequels. Opposing Force arms players with many alien weapons, most notably, the embryo of one of the game's most memorable alien enemies. It also adds a handheld barnacle which, while ridiculous, is used as a grappling hook very similar to the recently added Team Fortress 2 grapple. The dislocator, although impractical as a weapon outside of emergencies, is a very interesting idea for a weapon, as it allows limited travel between Earth and Xen. 

I highly reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys speedrunning, the original Half-Life series, hard games, or doesn't mind trying older titles.

Opposing force is a great game and I recomend this game if you liked half life. Return to Black Mesa as one of the marines sent in to cover up the situation. The game adds a bunch of new things including 8 new weapons, 6 new enimies, and climbing ropes. I would give this game a solid 9/10

The best addition to the best shooters of the 90s. In contrast to the official Blue Shift, which seemed to me not sufficiently applying for a complete addon, this addition is quite interesting in terms of plot. And, of course, a couple of improvements and additions, such as a wrench and a pair of new guns, the game fell to the site. A good example of how to do add-ons.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is a very satisfying expansion for the original game. It's much shorter, but it's just as challenging and fun. Also, it provides a unique and interesting perspective on the main story that ultimately enhances the Half-Life universe. And as for gameplay, there's lots of amazing extra content, such as new allies, weapons, and enemies. Overall, the game's just great, and I highly recommend playing it after finishing the original Half-Life.

Première extension d'Half-Life. C'est très décevant, comparé au jeu original.
Même mécanisme, bon gunfight, un peu plus difficiles en effet.
Mais scénario quasiment inexistant, même la fin n'apporte à peu près rien.
Les nouveaux ennemis sont bienvenus, on sent l'effort, mais il n'ont pas le cachet des précédents dans HL1. (Genre les grands aliens bipèdes un peu boursouflés sont assez nuls en design... Tout comme les genre de queen géantes)
Les black ops sont rapides, mais absurdement blindés; si l'unique moyen d'augmenter la difficulté c'est de les rendre blindés, boaf...
Une extension sympa, qui prolonge un peu, mais qui est très fade comparée à HL1.
If this game is not within your library you are not worthy of my respect.
